Message.Explanation: The FFDC has created an incident stream file to store the data relevant to this incident in this file.

Message.MsgText: FFDCJANITOR_FAILED_TO_GET_EXCEPTION_FILES_LIST=FFDC0001W: FFDC log file management failed to obtain list of exception files
Message.Explanation: FFDC attempted to list files in the log directory but the operation failed. Most likely cause is that the file system is not available or the process running FFDC does not have permission to list files in the log directory.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the file system containing the log directory is available and that the process running FFDC is allowed to list files in the log directory.

Message.MsgText: FFDCJANITOR_FAILED_TO_DELETE_FILE=FFDC0003I: FFDC log file management failed to delete file {0}
Message.Explanation: The management of the FFDC log files attempted to delete a file but the operation failed.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the file system containing the log directory is available and that the process running FFDC is allowed to delete files in the log directory.

Message.MsgText: FFDCAnalysisEngineUsing=FFDC1009I: Analysis Engine using data base: {0}
Message.Explanation: Info about the qualified DBName being used by the analysis engine

Message.MsgText: INCIDENTSTREAMIMPL_FAILED_TO_OPEN_FILE=FFDC0011I: FFDC failed to open or create incident stream file {0}, caught exception {1}
Message.Explanation: Attempt to create or open an incident stream file failed with an exception.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the file system containing the log directory is available and that the process running FFDC is allowed to create and access files in the log directory.

Message.Explanation: An FFDC Incident has been created at the location in the msg

Message.MsgText: INCIDENTSTREAMIMPL_FAILED_TO_CLOSE_FILE=FFDC0012I: FFDC failed to close incident stream file {0}, caught exception {1}
Message.Explanation: Attempt to create or open an incident stream file failed with an exception.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the file system containing the log directory is available and that the process running FFDC is allowed to access files in the log directory.

Message.MsgText: INCIDENTSTREAMIMPL_FAILED_TO_WRITE_TO_FILE=FFDC0013I: FFDC failed to write to incident stream file {0}, caught exception {1}
Message.Explanation: Attempt to write to an incident stream file failed with an exception.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the file system containing the log directory is available and that the process running FFDC is allowed to write into the files in the log directory.

Message.MsgText: INCIDENTSTREAMIMPL_CLOSED_FILE=FFDC0010I: FFDC closed incident stream file {0}
Message.Explanation: The FFDC has closed an incident stream file.

Message.MsgText: FFDCJANITOR_ATTEMPTING_TO_DELETE_FILE=FFDC0002I: FFDC log file management attempting to delete file {0}
Message.Explanation: The management of the FFDC log files is about to delete a file because it has met the conditions for automatic deletion.

Message.MsgText: FFDCJANITOR_DELETED_FILES=FFDC0004I: FFDC log file management removed {0} of {1} files that have reached their configured maximum age
Message.Explanation: The management of the FFDC log files has deleted old files.
